## describe/capture what your dynamic report is tracking

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)

logged_data <- read_csv("data.csv")

latest_data <- logged_data %>%
  select(-1) %>%     
  rename(colour = 1,
         style = 2,
         stories = 3,
         dwellings = 4)

ggplot(latest_data, aes(x = stories)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Number of house stories", x = "Stories", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
ggplot(latest_data, aes(x = dwellings)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Number of dwellings per section", x = "Stories", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
stories=mean(latest_data$stories)
dwellings=mean(latest_data$dwellings)
```

The mean stories in a house is `r stories`

The mean number of dwellings on a section is `r dwellings`
